event.title: was founded by refugees from the 1906

data.event: El Cerrito was founded by refugees from the 1906 San Francisco earthquake.
It was incorporated in 1917 as a village with 1500 residents.

The top 20 employers in the city, according to the 2013 Comprehensive Annual Financial Report, include such entities as the West Contra Costa Unified School District, City of El Cerrito, Lucky Stores, Pastime ACE Hardware, and Honda of El Cerrito.

event.title: was founded by refugees from the 1906

data.event: El Cerrito was founded by refugees from the 1906 San Francisco earthquake.
A post office opened at the settlement in 1909 and the refugee camp became known as Rust, after Wilhelm F. Rust, its first postmaster.

event.title: changed it to El Cerrito in 1916

data.event: The village's residents did not care for the name and changed it to El Cerrito in 1916.

event.title: A year later, El Cerrito was incorporated

data.event: A year later, El Cerrito was incorporated as a village with 1,500 residents.
